eral complained of me. I congratulated him on Mack's arrival . . . What's the matter, Rost6v? You look as if you'd just come out of a hot bath." 
"Oh, my dear fellow, we're in such a stew here these last two days." 
The regimental adjutant came in and con- firmed the news brought by Zherk6v. They were under orders to advance next day. 
"We're going into action, gentlemen!" 
"Well, thank God! We've been sitting here too long!" 
Kunfzov FELL BACK toward Vienna, destroying behind him the bridg
